Job description

Senior Project Manager

  • Large corporate organisation
  • 6 month contract
  • Melbourne Based


An immediate opportunity has arisen with a fast growing and rapidly evolving organisation for an experienced and driven Senior Project Manager.


The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and experience:


  • 5+ years project management experience
  • Experience managing Technology and Business projects
  • Outstanding stakeholder management skills up to C level
  • The ability to liaise with both Technology and the business
  • Proven experience managing teams on a complex and time driven project to achieve the business outcome/s
  • Experience in preparing and presenting steering committee documents


You will possess outstanding communication skills and have proven experience managing complex stakeholders whilst being able to focus on the delivery of concurrent projects. Experience in both waterfall and agile project methodologies is requirement as well as being able to manage the project team to deliver the systems implementation.


You will have worked with various Project tools (MS Project, Visio) and any formal PM certifications (Prince 2, PMBOK) would be ideal.

\xa0

For a confidential discussion, please email Trent Pearson at Ampersand on tpearson@ampersand.com.au

818914541:
[

Buyer - Kids Footwear

Company Name Kmart Australia Limited Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 185 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Kmart, families come first for the lowest prices on everyday items. Our vision is to make everyday living brighter for all of our customers, every time, everywhere they shop with us.

As Australia’s brightest retail star, we have experienced great success in recent times. For Kmart this is just the beginning of our exciting journey ahead! We have big plans in place to ensure we deliver our vision and significantly expand our business. With another 40 new stores opening across Australia and New Zealand, the growth of our online business and expansion into new markets, we are on a mission to improve the Kmart shopping experience for all our customers, who are at the heart of everything we do. There has never been a more irresistible time to join Kmart!

Over the past few years we’ve revolutionised the way we buy and merchandise our produ ct and have successfully transformed our business into one of Australia’s most successful discount department store retailers. Our focus is to deliver an exceptional own brand product whilst ensuring we maintain extraordinarily low prices whilst delivering great quality. Our Buying team, in partnership with our Designers and Planners are critical to the success of Kmart and we are currently seeking applications from experienced Buyers for an opportunity in our Kids’s Footwear business.

Responsibilities

Based at our National Office in Mulgrave, as Footwear Buyer at Kmart Australia, you will be responsible for driving growth in a specific category and your responsibilities will include
  • Managing the Critical Path Process from design to production to pricing to store, all in collaboration with designers and planners.
  • Custodian of customer insights relevant to your category to aid in identifying and delivering product ranging that targets our core customer needs.
  • Direct management of one or two Buyer Assistants
  • In conjunction with the Business Managers, develop and deliver strategic direction, as well as tactical merchandise plans, incorporating business plans and market trends.
  • Assist in managing the financial plans to achieve sales, calculate income and stock turn.
  • Ensure all merchandise conforms to quality standards and legal requirements whilst adhering to a low cost low price model.
  • Manage the approved Kmart supplier relationships as well as regularly evaluate performance to ensure service level requirements are met.

To be successful for this role, you will ideally possess the following critical skills and experience;
  • Prior experience in Apparel Merchandise Retail Buying preferably in Kids Footwear with a large volume retailer.
  • Proven success driving category growth and delivering increased profit through development and delivery of private label ranging.
  • Direct (ethical) Sourcing and Product Development experience having worked with Footwear design and planning teams to bring a vision to life.
  • Well-honed commercial skills combined with the ability to analyse customer’s needs, conduct market research and engage with our Customer Insights Team to establish effective merchandise strategies and develop on-trend ranges.
  • People management experience of Junior Buyers or Buying Assistants
  • Success oriented, you thrive in a team environment and enjoy being able to contribute to a business where you can further drive growth.

You will benefit from joining an amazing business and a dynamic team who are all committed to the success of Kmart and providing our customers with a great shopping experience. Our values – Think Customer, Take Care, Live Integrity, Grow Together and Reach Higher will resonate with you closely and you’ll enjoy being part of a growing, iconic Australian business that has a fantastic culture that is non-hierarchical, diverse and inclusive. Your work environment will be highly collaborative, fast-paced and progressive, with no two days the same!

You will be afforded autonomy and accountability in your role and have access to development opportunities across both Kmart and the Wesfarmers Group, exceptional remuneration, a generous bonus scheme & access to Wesfarmers share plan and benefits program including a discount card for Kmart, Coles, Target and Officeworks. So if this sounds like the perfect role for you – apply now!

At Kmart we aim to ensure our teams reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate.

Candidates interested in this position should apply directly to this advertisement as we are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies.

Industry

  • Apparel & Fashion
  • Consumer Goods
  • Retail

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Purchasing
  • Supply Chain

835014642:

Associate Director, Aboriginal Services

Company Name Victoria Legal Aid Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 27 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Senior position leading improved legal aid services for Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander people
  • Provide organisational leadership for initiatives within our Reconciliation Action Plan
  • Salary commensurate with experience, range: $136,230-$156,705 per annum plus super, benefits include cultural and ceremonial leave


    • About the role:
    This role leads VLA's commitment to recognise the unique strengths, identities and needs of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. Reporting to the Managing Director, you will be well supported to build VLA's capacity to carry out key initiatives that encourage access to and delivery of legal services that reflect the specific needs and barriers to access of these communities. You will also play a key leadership role in the ongoing development of an inclusive organisational environment for all staff to work and thrive in.

    You will provide leadership and mentoring to a team of Aboriginal Community Engagement Officers who collaborate with Aboriginal communities and Aboriginal community-led organisations in the legal, health and housing sectors. You will provide organisational leadership to progress initiatives in our Reconciliation Action Plan by building capacity across the organisation to help fulfil our commitments.

    As part of the senior leadership team, you will contribute to strengthening VLA's ability to help more Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people with their legal problems through inclusive and culturally safe client service delivery and community engagement.

    About you:
    This role provides an exciting opportunity to use your knowledge and understanding of the needs of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to bring about change. You will demonstrate leadership and relationship building skills gained from experience in a community organisation, the public sector or the legal sector. These qualities will see you develop and maintain cooperative relationships with key internal staff and external stakeholders that enhance our ability to work more effectively with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander clients. You will also inspire confidence, easily build rapport and influence opinions across the organisation as well as demonstrate a commitment to our values and social justice principles.

    This position is only open to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. Victoria Legal Aid considers that being Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander is a genuine occupational requirement for this position under section 26(3) or section 28 of the Equal Opportunity Act 2010 (Vic).

    Employee benefits:
    We offer attractive employment benefits including salary packaging (making part of your salary tax-free), cultural and ceremonial leave, flexible working arrangements, family friendly policies and opportunities for professional development. Whilst the work is challenging, you will be rewarded with a culture that is focused on achieving quality outcomes for disadvantaged Victorians.

    How to apply:
    To apply, visit our Careers web page. Submit a current resume and covering letter that details your interest in and suitability for the role. For further information review the attached position description or contact Tilda Hum, Acting Chief of Staff on 03 9269 0246.

    Applications close Sunday 2 September 2018

Job description

APP Corporation

APP is a 'client side' project management consultancy specialising in the Property and Infrastructure industries.

We have some of the best people in the industry, all committed to shaping the future of Australia's economic and social infrastructure, our communities and our workplaces. In achieving this, we’re a proud trusted partner to many of Australia’s leading businesses.

Our engagements range from providing advice on small niche assignments to the full spectrum of end-to-end services on major landmark projects, and everything in between.

The Opportunity
\xa0
We are currently seeking both Project Managers and Senior Project Mangers to deliver a program of projects to a major client in the highly successful Programs Solutions division of the business.
\xa0
Program Solutions is a dedicated division that specialises in the delivery of strategic multi-site Capital Works programs across Australia. For clients wishing to repositioning their Real Estate portfolio we focus on the design and implementation of bespoke end to end solutions from the strategy through definition, delivery and transition.
\xa0
About You

Passionate and driven, you thrive working in a team-based environment, and embody our core values: to Own it. Strive. Do What's Right. And Respect.


To be considered for these positions you will have:


  • A tertiary degree in Engineering, Architecture, Building Surveying, Building, Planning, Project Management, Construction Management or Property Development.
  • Motivated and well networked individual
  • 3 - 8 years' related work experience
  • Multisite experience leading capital works programs
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • A proactive and self-motivated approach to work, with a can-do attitude
  • Excellent accuracy and attention to detail
  • Excellent interpersonal and consultative skills


To apply or hear more about this opportunity, please send through your CV to Vicky Hewitt.

Manager, ISV

Company Name AustralianSuper Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 80 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

To support the growth of AustralianSuper we are seeking Manager, ISV who will be responsible for defining, managing and maintaining the integrity of the security master reference and valuation data within the Investment Department. Reporting to Manager, Data Strategy and Architecture this role represents an outstanding opportunity to support the Data Management team in ensuring the accuracy and completeness of security valuation and master reference data.

In this role, you will be accountable for the quality of data in relation to the maintenance of assets within the agreed timelines. You will work closely with the Manager, Market Data Relationships and external parties to ensure that all Investment data is Fit for Purpose. You will define the security reference and valuation data models for new products and instruments used by the department and ensure there is a robust understanding across the Asset Class and investment teams of their different uses in various contexts.

You’ll need…

A background in securities pricing and maintenance and experience working within asset management or financial services. You will be a multi-taker with excellent attention to detail and excel skills. You will have a solid understanding of valuations, valuations instruments and instruments across various asset classes. You will have the ability to research and provide sufficient evidence related to pricing decisions and maintain documentation supporting the valuation process. We are seeking strong communicators with the ability to build collaborative relationships across a variety of stakeholders.

If you would like the opportunity to work in a challenging, growing and rapidly evolving environment to deliver outstanding results that benefit members, please apply now! Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

Please note, this role is deemed to be an Access Person role. Disclosure and Personal Trading requirements apply to the successful candidate

815599203:
[

Digital Project Manager

Company Name Doghouse Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 526 views

Job description

Doghouse Agency is a fast-growing, award winning Australian digital agency with an exciting portfolio of diverse, high profile clients. We pride ourselves on our vibrant culture, innovative minds and enthusiasm for the latest in technology and design trends.


We’re a close knit team of 27 in-house, headquartered in Perth and offices in Melbourne. As a boutique agency we’re nimble and agile. Most importantly, we believe in reinforcing a strong culture around the work we do.\xa0


With a strong emphasis on technology and development, we tell it how it is and aim to deliver best-in-breed solutions that balance quality and pragmatism to deliver solid value for money results.


What’s a typical day like at the Doghouse?


Grab a coffee then jump in your morning stand up. Touch base with project teams via Slack and hangouts.\xa0 Set up your Scrum or Kanban in Jira, manage feedback and empower your teams to reach maximum productivity.


As the first point of call for your clients, you’ll be the face of Doghouse. Keeping in regular communication, negotiating change requests and navigating complex stakeholder engagements will be a driving passion of yours.

\xa0

What are we expecting of the role?


Ensuring ongoing client satisfaction requires constant care and maintenance of long-term relationships.


High-level requirements of this position include:


  • Taking ownership of your clients and projects - this is absolutely integral to how we manage our client relationships at Doghouse
  • Working to secure signing and approval of contracts and invoicing milestones to manage financial and contract risk
  • Creating project boards and working with tech leads to maintain an efficient workflow, ensuring feedback and scope changes are effectively managed through backlog grooming and pruning processes
  • Working with technical leads to determine the scope of projects and aim for the best outcomes for our clients
  • Ensuring clients are kept up to date with timelines and budgets, and ensuring project budgets are met
  • Communicating key milestones to clients and acting as an interface between clients and our production team
  • Identifying growth opportunities among existing clients and working with technical leads to develop proposals


Your key attributes:


  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strategic thinking and commercial acumen, with a demonstrable ability to balance competing priorities in order to achieve outcomes that are in the best interests of our business
  • Advanced client relationship skills and professionalism when dealing with clients and our internal team
  • Presentable and professional demeanour
  • Understand the lifecycle of website development
  • Confident with giving your educated opinion on project approach
  • Strong scope management skills, with the ability to manage client expectations while maintaining positive relationships - not as easy as it sounds
  • Ability to work and problem solve under pressure, thinking outside the square to identify risks and opportunities and develop effective strategies to capitalise on any situation
  • Excellent time management skills - you will be busy with multiple clients and projects
  • Ability to effectively manage a team


Your experience:


  • At least 3 years experience in client services, account management and / or sales roles
  • Minimum 2 years of Web Agency service delivery experience
  • Experience with and sound knowledge of digital strategy, marketing, design and UX principles
  • Experience with supervising and managing teams
  • Demonstrated experience in scoping and managing web based projects
  • High level understanding of Content Management Systems and platforms, technologies and processes
  • If you have a strong technical background in addition to the required account management experience, this would be viewed very favourably
  • Scrum Certification preferred


We look forward to hearing from you, and good luck!


No Recruiters Please.

Contact the job poster

Simon Shackleton

Director at Doghouse

Company Name Village Roadshow Company Location South Yarra, VIC

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 54 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Process Improvement Analyst – Finance


  • 12 month FTC
  • Consult and provide input towards identifying the best solutions
  • Apply your experience focusing on finance processes

The role you will play:

Successfully building and leveraging internal stakeholder relationships you will be responsible for supporting our divisional finance process owners to research and investigate challenges or new opportunities and continually improve finance processes.

This role will work within and across our various divisions and business units to build a detailed understanding of how our finance processes support the business operations end to end.


Initially focused on our Theme Parks processes this will see you:


  • Use various methods to prepare current state process maps in agreement with key stakeholders
  • With the assistance of subject matter experts, identify areas of process improvement
  • Improve efficiencies reduction of manual handling, implementation of technology or automation
  • Determine areas of finance process standardisation across the group
  • Assist in the facilitation of scoping and business priority setting for finance process change initiatives
  • Contribute to the selection of the most appropriate means of representing business requirements in the context of a change initiative

\xa0

Desired Skills and Experience

Experience:


This role requires both excellent interpersonal and open communication skills and the proven ability to facilitate effective discussions with all organizational levels. With an ability to identify right-fit processes to support business objectives driven from previous experience within a process improvement environment you will be supported by experts across the business.


Most importantly your ability to consult and collaborate with stakeholders will see you succeed in our exciting environment. In return, Village Roadshow offers an opportunity to develop and grow your career with a large organisation while partnering with engaged and passionate individuals sharing a common goal of success.


Apply now!
